TopicTitle: question about getting ksp 0.14.4 again i do have 0.15

Articles.Content:
wish to make a video but sadly i got 0.15 and did not save the 0.14.4 file when i got it 

needles to say im getting that out of memory bug in 0.15... so making a video is near imposable being i wish to use 2 mods

0.14.4 worked for me and wish to get it again

so my question is this...... how do i get it dont see a link anywhere on this site to get it

BUT i do see theres some torrents of it was wondering being i all ready paid for it can i get it that way or well that be a bad idea i know theres no drm in this game but feel so bad about getting an old version that way 

P.S if its not a good idea and if the torrents need to be reported i well give links to what ive found

Currently, archived versions of the program aren\'t available. 

While I do realize your referencing an old version, discussing alternate methods of acquiring it are frowned upon and discussing sites of a Caribbean privateer nature is prohibited. You can forward any you find to me via PM, but chances are I already know and/or there may be nothing that can be done.

Cheers!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager

please accept my deepest apology on this matter did not know asking about an archived version was frowned upon

guess ill wait till that bug is fixed to make the video

Ah, misunderstanding. Asking about the archived version isn\'t a problem. It\'s discussing 'pirate' sources of the game.

Cheers!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager
It does seem... strange that we do not have access to the previous versions, but that is why I backup my current version first. It is unfortunate.

I don\'t think it\'s intentional that we can\'t get copies of old versions. I expect it\'s more that it has very little demand and would require some effort to set up a system to provide downloads. I\'m sure that if more than a couple people asked Harvester for a previous version download page he\'d be happy to sort it out.

Since you bought a license to the game rather than a specific copy it doesn\'t matter where you acquire one from from the devs perspective; I would just suggest that only official means are \'encouraged\' or \'supported\'.

You can keep older versions. You just can\'t share them with others, unless they are demo(0.13 or previous) versions.

A company-kept archive might be handy, but it would require extra labor to maintain and be sure that anything shared was going to legit customers. In the end, it just isn\'t that important to implement.
